member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.ShapefileReader.Location.Invalid
member.summary: Gets a value that represents an invalid Location structure.
member.remarks: A Location structure with Latitude and Longitude values set to 0 is not empty. An empty Location structure has Latitude and Longitude values set to negative infinity. This is the only time a Location structure can have negative infinity values.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this Location structure is empty.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.AngularUnitOfMeasurement
member.summary: Gets or sets the measurement units used to define the angles of a spheroid or ellipse associated with a specific datum. The datum is usually WGS (World Geodetic System) 1984 and the unit of measurement is a degree.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.Authority
member.summary: Gets or sets the authority body that defines the standards for the spatial reference parameters. Spatial Reference is usually WGS 1984 and the authority is EPSG:4326.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.CentralMeridian
member.summary: Gets or sets the line of longitude at the center of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.Datum
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal datum, which corresponds to the procedure used to measure positions on the surface of the Earth.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.DatumAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal datum, which corresponds to the procedure used to measure positions on the surface of the Earth.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.FalseEasting
member.summary: Gets or sets the value added to all "x" values in the rectangular coordinate for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.FalseNorthing
member.summary: Gets or sets the value added to all "y" values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.GeoGcs
member.summary: Gets or sets a coordinate system based on latitude and longitude. Some geographic coordinate systems are Latitude/Longitude, and some are Longitude/Latitude. You can find out which this is by examining the axes. You should also check the angular units, since not all geographic coordinate systems use degrees.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.LatitudeOfOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets the latitude chosen as the origin of rectangular coordinate for a map projection.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.Primem
member.summary: Gets or sets the meridian used to take longitude measurements from. The units of the longitude must be inferred from the context.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.PrimemAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets the meridian used to take longitude measurements from. The units of the longitude must be inferred from the context.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.ProjectionAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets a projection from geographic coordinates to projected coordinates.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.SpheroidRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.SpheroidFlattening
member.summary: Gets or sets a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.SpheroidAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets a spheroid, which is an approximation of the Earth's surface as a squashed sphere.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.StandardParallel
member.summary: Gets or sets the line of constant latitude at which the surface of the Earth and the plane or developable surface intersect.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.UnitAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets the authority body that defines the unit of measurement i.e. European Petroleum Survey Group (EPSG). The unit of measurement is usually degrees and the authority for the datum the map uses, WGS 1984 is EPSG:4326.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.MinLatitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum Latitude this tile source supports.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.MaxLatitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum Latitude this tile source supports.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum Longitude this tile source supports.

member.name: P:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.ISpatialReference.MaxLongitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum Longitude this tile source supports.

member.summary: Converts a logical Point (0->1) to a geographical coordinate (Longitude, Latitude).

member.name: T:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.MercatorProjection
member.summary: Mercator is the projection used by most online maps including Virtual Earth, GMaps and Yahoo It maintains Vertical resolution while expanding the earth horizontally to fill The effect is that items at the poles appear much larger then those of equal size at the equator.

member.name: M:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.MercatorProjection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MercatorProjection class. Mercator is the projection used by most online maps including Virtual Earth, GMaps and Yahoo.

member.summary: No selection is allowed.

member.name: F:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.SelectionMode.Single
member.summary: Single-shape selection is allowed. A shape is selected when tapped and deselected if tapped again. If a new shape is tapped, the previous selected one is deselected.

member.name: F:Telerik.XamarinForms.Map.SelectionMode.Multiple
member.summary: Multiple-shape selection is allowed. A shape is selected when tapped and deselected if tapped again.
